required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Treatment for Coronary Drug Eluting Stent In-stent Restenosis
clinical_study.official_title: OPtimal trEatment for coroNary Drug Eluting Stent In-Stent Restenosis: Paclitaxel Versus Sirolimus Coated Balloons Versus Everolimus Eluting Stents - The OPEN ISR Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

clinical_study.source: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this open label, randomized study is to compare the safety and efficacy of three different methods to handle coronary drug eluting stent (DES) in-stent restenosis (ISR).
These are the:
- Magic Touch - sirolimus coated balloon
- Emperor - paclitaxel and dextran coated balloon
- Xience - chromium-cobalt everolimus eluting stent

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of new onset target vessel myocardial infarction
primary_outcome.description: New onset myocardial infarction that affects the target vessel treated with either study device

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of target vessel revascularization of failure
primary_outcome.description: The need for further revascularization affecting the target vessel treated with either study device, or the failure of the vessel treated by either study device.
The need for further revascularization of the target lesion after treatment with either study device.

secondary_outcome.description: Late lumen loss measured via qualitative coronary angiography in treated segment(s)
Intraluminal gain after assigned treatment measured via optical coherence tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Square millimetre intraluminal gain after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Intraluminal gain after assigned treatment measured via optical coherence tomography
Intraluminal gain after assigned treatment measured via optical coherence tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Square millimeter intraluminal gain after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Intraluminal gain after assigned treatment measured via optical coherence tomography
Mean endothelium thickness of stent struts in micrometres measured via optical coherence tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Late lumen loss in square millimetres
secondary_outcome.description: Late lumen loss in square millimetres measured via optical coherence tomography

arm_group.description: The Xience chromium-cobalt everolimus eluting stent will be evaluated in prior implanted coronary drug eluting stent restenosis.
The Emperor paclitaxel coated balloon will be evaluated in prior implanted coronary drug eluting stent restenosis.
The Magic Touch sirolimus coated balloon will be evaluated in prior implanted coronary drug eluting stent restenosis.

intervention.intervention_name: Intravascular management of prior implanted coronary drug eluting stent restenosis
intervention.description: Intravascular devices will be assessed for the management of prior implanted drug eluting stent restenosis management.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted for intervention of drug eluting stent restenosis
- Restenosis suitable for all three treatment arms as per 'instructions for use' of the devices
- Optional enrollment in the optical coherence tomography sub-study (10-20% of patients)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing coronary angiography after sudden cardiac death
- Pregnant or nursing

overall_official.affiliation: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

facility.name: University of Szeged, Department of Invasive Cardiology
Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Semmelweis University Heart and Vascular Center
